Title: Battle Royale

Title: Wonder Woman

Casts: Vin Diesel,  Paul Walker,  Dwayne Johnson,  Michelle Rodriguez
Synopsis: After defeating international terrorist Owen Shaw, Dominic Toretto (Vin Diesel), Brian O'Conner (Paul Walker) and the rest of the crew...
Census: Serving up a fresh round of over-the-top thrills while adding unexpected dramatic heft, Furious 7 keeps the franchise moving in more ways than one.

Title: La Femme Nikita
Casts: Anne Parillaud,  Jean-Hugues Anglade,  Tcheky Karyo,  Jeanne Moreau
Synopsis: Convicted felon Nikita (Anne Parillaud), instead of going to jail, is given a new identity and trained to be a...
Census: A zany out-of-control thriller that gives lead Anne Parillaud a big character arc and plenty of emotional room to work within.

Title: Supercop
Casts: Jackie Chan,  Michelle Yeaoh,  Maggie Cheung,  Ken Tsang
Synopsis: To infiltrate a drug cartel, police Inspector Chan Ka Kui (Jackie Chan) goes undercover in a Chinese prison. There, he...
Census: Blending hand-to-hand combat with breathtaking stunts and slapstick comedy, Supercop reminds us why Jackie Chan is one of the world's great entertainers.

Title: Dirty Harry
Casts: Clint Eastwood,  Harry Guardino,  Reni Santoni,  John Larch
Synopsis: Cop Harry Callahan (Clint Eastwood) attempts to track down a psychopathic rooftop killer before a kidnapped girl dies. When he...
Census: As tough and taciturn as its no-nonsense hero, Dirty Harry delivers a deceptively layered message without sacrificing an ounce of its solid action impact.

Title: Edge of Tomorrow
Casts: Tom Cruise,  Emily Blunt,  Brendan Gleeson,  Bill Paxton
Synopsis: When Earth falls under attack from invincible aliens, no military unit in the world is able to beat them. Maj....
Census: Gripping, well-acted, funny, and clever, Edge of Tomorrow offers entertaining proof that Tom Cruise is still more than capable of shouldering the weight of a blockbuster action thriller.

Title: X2
Casts: Patrick Stewart,  Hugh Jackman,  Ian McKellen,  Halle Berry
Synopsis: Stryker (Brian Cox), a villianous former Army commander, holds the key to Wolverine's (Hugh Jackman) past and the future of...
Census: Tightly scripted, solidly acted, and impressively ambitious, X2: X-Men United is bigger and better than its predecessor -- and a benchmark for comic sequels in general.

Title: The Fugitive
Casts: Harrison Ford,  Tommy Lee Jones,  Sela Ward,  Julianne Moore
Synopsis: Wrongfully accused of murdering his wife, Richard Kimble (Harrison Ford) escapes from the law in an attempt to find her...
Census: Exhilarating and intense, this high-impact chase thriller is a model of taut and efficient formula filmmaking, and it features Harrison Ford at his frantic best.

Title: Black Panther
Casts: Chadwick Boseman,  Michael B. Jordan,  Lupita Nyong'o,  Danai Gurira
Synopsis: After the death of his father, T'Challa returns home to the African nation of Wakanda to take his rightful place...
Census: Black Panther elevates superhero cinema to thrilling new heights while telling one of the MCU's most absorbing stories -- and introducing some of its most fully realized characters.

Title: Inception
Casts: Leonardo DiCaprio,  Joseph Gordon-Levitt,  Ellen Page,  Tom Hardy
Synopsis: Dom Cobb (Leonardo DiCaprio) is a thief with the rare ability to enter people's dreams and steal their secrets from...
Census: Smart, innovative, and thrilling, Inception is that rare summer blockbuster that succeeds viscerally as well as intellectually.

Title: Braveheart
Casts: Mel Gibson,  Sophie Marceau,  Patrick McGoohan,  Catherine McCormack
Synopsis: Tells the story of the legendary thirteenth century Scottish hero named William Wallace (Mel Gibson). Wallace rallies the Scottish against...
Census: Distractingly violent and historically dodgy, Mel Gibson's Braveheart justifies its epic length by delivering enough sweeping action, drama, and romance to match its ambition.

Title: Minority Report
Casts: Tom Cruise,  Colin Farrell,  Samantha Morton,  Max von Sydow
Synopsis: Based on a story by famed science fiction writer Philip K. Dick, "Minority Report" is an action-detective thriller set in...
Census: Thought-provoking and visceral, Steven Spielberg successfully combines high concept ideas and high octane action in this fast and febrile sci-fi thriller.

Title: Avengers: Endgame
Casts: Robert Downey Jr.,  Chris Evans,  Mark Ruffalo,  Chris Hemsworth
Synopsis: Adrift in space with no food or water, Tony Stark sends a message to Pepper Potts as his oxygen supply...
Census: Exciting, entertaining, and emotionally impactful, Avengers: Endgame does whatever it takes to deliver a satisfying finale to Marvel's epic Infinity Saga.

Title: Dredd
Casts: Karl Urban,  Olivia Thirlby,  Lena Headey,  Wood Harris
Synopsis: Mega City One is a vast, violent metropolis where felons rule the streets. The only law lies with cops called...
Census: Fueled by bombastic violence and impressive special effects, rooted in self-satire and deadpan humor, Dredd 3D does a remarkable job of capturing its source material's gritty spirit.

Title: The Bourne Identity
Casts: Matt Damon,  Franka Potente,  Chris Cooper,  Clive Owen
Synopsis: The story of a man (Matt Damon), salvaged, near death, from the ocean by an Italian fishing boat. When he...
Census: Expertly blending genre formula with bursts of unexpected wit, The Bourne Identity is an action thriller that delivers -- and then some.

Title: Ip Man
Casts: Donnie Yen,  Simon Yam,  Siu-wong Fan,  Ka Tung Lam
Synopsis: The life story of Yip Man, the first person to teach the Chinese martial art of Wing Chun....
Census: At once beholden to the established conventions of the genre and delightfully subversive of them, Ip Man is one of the most exciting -- and refreshingly character-driven -- martial arts films in years.

Title: Face/Off
Casts: John Travolta,  Nicolas Cage,  Joan Allen,  Alessandro Nivola
Synopsis: Obsessed with bringing terrorist Castor Troy (Nicolas Cage) to justice, FBI agent Sean Archer (John Travolta) tracks down Troy, who...
Census: John Travolta and Nicolas Cage play cat-and-mouse (and literally play each other) against a beautifully stylized backdrop of typically elegant, over-the-top John Woo violence.

Title: To Live and Die in L.A.
Casts: William L. Petersen,  Willem Dafoe,  John Pankow,  Debra Feuer
Synopsis: When his longtime partner on the force is killed, reckless U.S. Secret Service agent Richard Chance (William L. Petersen) vows...
Census: With coke fiends, car chases, and Wang Chung galore, To Live and Die in L.A. is perhaps the ultimate '80s action/thriller.

Title: The Dark Knight
Casts: Christian Bale,  Heath Ledger,  Aaron Eckhart,  Michael Caine
Synopsis: With the help of allies Lt. Jim Gordon (Gary Oldman) and DA Harvey Dent (Aaron Eckhart), Batman (Christian Bale) has...
Census: Dark, complex, and unforgettable, The Dark Knight succeeds not just as an entertaining comic book film, but as a richly thrilling crime saga.

Title: Mission: Impossible -- Ghost Protocol
Casts: Tom Cruise,  Jeremy Renner,  Simon Pegg,  Paula Patton
Synopsis: Blamed for a terrorist attack on the Kremlin, Ethan Hunt (Tom Cruise) and the entire IMF agency are disavowed by...
Census: Stylish, fast-paced, and loaded with gripping set pieces, the fourth Mission: Impossible is big-budget popcorn entertainment that really works.

Title: Fast Five
Casts: Vin Diesel,  Paul Walker,  Jordana Brewster,  Tyrese Gibson
Synopsis: Ever since ex-cop Brian O'Conner (Paul Walker) and Mia Torretto (Jordana Brewster) broke her brother Dom (Vin Diesel) out of...
Census: Sleek, loud, and over the top, Fast Five proudly embraces its brainless action thrills and injects new life into the franchise.

Title: Lethal Weapon
Casts: Mel Gibson,  Danny Glover,  Gary Busey,  Mitchell Ryan
Synopsis: Following the death of his wife, Los Angeles police detective Martin Riggs (Mel Gibson) becomes reckless and suicidal. When he...
Census: The most successful installment in a phenomenally successful series, Lethal Weapon helped redefine action movies for the 1980s and 1990s.

Title: The Rock
Casts: Sean Connery,  Nicolas Cage,  Ed Harris,  Michael Biehn
Synopsis: FBI chemical warfare expert Stanley Goodspeed (Nicolas Cage) is sent on an urgent mission with a former British spy, John...
Census: For visceral thrills, it can't be beat. Just don't expect The Rock to engage your brain.

Title: RoboCop
Casts: Peter Weller,  Nancy Allen,  Ronny Cox,  Daniel O'Herlihy
Synopsis: In a violent, near-apocalyptic Detroit, evil corporation Omni Consumer Products wins a contract from the city government to privatize the...
Census: While over-the-top and gory, Robocop is also a surprisingly smart sci-fi flick that uses ultraviolence to disguise its satire of American culture.

Title: John Wick: Chapter 2
Casts: Keanu Reeves,  Common,  Laurence Fishburne,  Riccardo Scamarcio
Synopsis: Retired super-assassin John Wick's plans to resume a quiet civilian life are cut short when Italian gangster Santino D'Antonio shows...
Census: John Wick: Chapter 2 does what a sequel should -- which in this case means doubling down on the non-stop, thrillingly choreographed action that made its predecessor so much fun.

Title: Casino Royale
Casts: Daniel Craig,  Eva Green,  Mads Mikkelsen,  Judi Dench
Synopsis: After receiving a license to kill, British Secret Service agent James Bond (Daniel Craig) heads to Madagascar, where he uncovers...
Census: Casino Royale disposes of the silliness and gadgetry that plagued recent James Bond outings, and Daniel Craig delivers what fans and critics have been waiting for: a caustic, haunted, intense reinvention of 007.

Title: Baby Driver
Casts: Ansel Elgort,  Kevin Spacey,  Lily James,  Jon Bernthal
Synopsis: Talented getaway driver Baby (Ansel Elgort) relies on the beat of his personal soundtrack to be the best in the...
Census: Stylish, exciting, and fueled by a killer soundtrack, Baby Driver hits the road and it's gone -- proving fast-paced action movies can be smartly written without sacrificing thrills.

Title: Fist of Legend
Casts: Jet Li,  Chin Siu Ho,  Billy Chow,  Yasuaki Kurata
Synopsis: Chinese martial arts student Chen Zhen (Jet Li) is studying in Kyoto, Japan, when he learns his mentor has died...
Census: No consensus yet.

Title: The Killer
Casts: Chow Yun-Fat,  Danny Lee,  Sally Yeh,  Kenneth Tsang
Synopsis: Mob assassin Jeffrey (Chow Yun-Fat) is no ordinary hired gun; the best in his business, he views his chosen profession...
Census: The Killer is another hard-boiled action flick from John Woo featuring eye-popping balletic violence and philosophical underpinnings.

Title: The Raid 2
Casts: Iko Uwais,  Yayan Ruhian,  Arifin Putra,  Oka Antara
Synopsis: After surviving a bloody fight with powerful gangsters, rookie Jakarta cop Rama (Iko Uwais) thinks he can resume a normal...
Census: Although its high-energy plot and over-the-top violence may play better with genre aficionados, The Raid 2 definitely delivers more of everything audiences loved about its predecessor.

Title: Enter the Dragon
Casts: Bruce Lee,  John Saxon,  Jim Kelly,  Ahna Capri
Synopsis: Bruce Lee plays a martial-arts expert determined to help capture the narcotics dealer whose gang was responsible for the death...
Census: Badass to the max, Enter the Dragon is the ultimate kung-fu movie and fitting (if untimely) Bruce Lee swan song.

Title: Commando
Casts: Arnold Schwarzenegger,  Rae Dawn Chong,  Dan Hedaya,  Vernon Wells
Synopsis: Retired Special Forces soldier John Matrix (Arnold Schwarzenegger) lives with daughter Jenny (Alyssa Milano) in isolation, but his privacy is...
Census: No consensus yet.

Title: First Blood
Casts: Sylvester Stallone,  Richard Crenna,  Brian Dennehy,  David Caruso
Synopsis: Vietnam veteran and drifter John J. Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) wanders into a small Washington town in search of an old...
Census: Much darker and more sensitive than the sequels it spawned, First Blood is a thrilling survival adventure that takes full advantage of Sylvester Stallone's acting skills.

Title: Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation
Casts: Tom Cruise,  Jeremy Renner,  Simon Pegg,  Rebecca Ferguson
Synopsis: With the IMF now disbanded and Ethan Hunt (Tom Cruise) out in the cold, a new threat -- called the...
Census: Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation continues the franchise's thrilling resurgence -- and proves that Tom Cruise remains an action star without equal.

Title: The Terminator
Casts: Arnold Schwarzenegger,  Linda Hamilton,  Michael Biehn,  Paul Winfield
Synopsis: Disguised as a human, a cyborg assassin known as a Terminator (Arnold Schwarzenegger) travels from 2029 to 1984 to kill...
Census: With its impressive action sequences, taut economic direction, and relentlessly fast pace, it's clear why The Terminator continues to be an influence on sci-fi and action flicks.

Title: Gladiator
Casts: Russell Crowe,  Joaquin Phoenix,  Connie Nielsen,  Oliver Reed
Synopsis: Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) takes power and strips rank from Maximus (Russell Crowe), one of the favored generals of his predecessor...
Census: Ridley Scott and an excellent cast successfully convey the intensity of Roman gladitorial combat as well as the political intrigue brewing beneath.

Title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
Casts: Uma Thurman,  Lucy Liu,  Vivica A. Fox,  Michael Madsen
Synopsis: A former assassin, known simply as The Bride (Uma Thurman), wakes from a coma four years after her jealous ex-lover...
Census: Kill Bill is admittedly little more than a stylish revenge thriller -- albeit one that benefits from a wildly inventive surfeit of style.

Title: The Professional
Casts: Jean Reno,  Gary Oldman,  Natalie Portman,  Danny Aiello
Synopsis: Mathilda (Natalie Portman) is only 12 years old, but is already familiar with the dark side of life: her abusive...
Census: Pivoting on the unusual relationship between seasoned hitman and his 12-year-old apprentice -- a breakout turn by young Natalie Portman -- Luc Besson's LÃ©on is a stylish and oddly affecting thriller.

Title: Speed
Casts: Keanu Reeves,  Dennis Hopper,  Sandra Bullock,  Joe Morton
Synopsis: Los Angeles police officer Jack (Keanu Reeves) angers retired bomb squad member Howard Payne (Dennis Hopper) by foiling his attempt...
Census: A terrific popcorn thriller, Speed is taut, tense, and energetic, with outstanding performances from Keanu Reeves, Dennis Hopper, and Sandra Bullock.

Title: Drunken Master II
Casts: Jackie Chan,  Ti Lung,  Anita Mui,  Kar-leung Lau
Synopsis: From a land where honor and tradition reign, comes the legend of a martial-arts hero unlike any other -- the...
Census: Jackie Chan sends up some amazing and entertaining fight sequences in The Legend of Drunken Master.

Title: John Wick
Casts: Keanu Reeves,  Michael Nyqvist,  Alfie Allen,  Willem Dafoe
Synopsis: Legendary assassin John Wick (Keanu Reeves) retired from his violent career after marrying the love of his life. Her sudden...
Census: Stylish, thrilling, and giddily kinetic, John Wick serves as a satisfying return to action for Keanu Reeves -- and what looks like it could be the first of a franchise.

Title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
Casts: Chow Yun-Fat,  Michelle Yeoh,  Zhang Ziyi,  Chen Chang
Synopsis: In 19th century Qing Dynasty China, a warrior (Chow Yun-Fat) gives his sword, Green Destiny, to his lover (Michelle Yeoh)...
Census: The movie that catapulted Ang Lee into the ranks of upper echelon Hollywood filmmakers, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon features a deft mix of amazing martial arts battles, beautiful scenery, and tasteful drama.

Title: Predator
Casts: Arnold Schwarzenegger,  Carl Weathers,  Jesse Ventura,  Elpidia Carrillo
Synopsis: Dutch (Arnold Schwarzenegger), a soldier of fortune, is hired by the U.S. government to secretly rescue a group of politicians...
Census: Predator: Part sci-fi, part horror, part action -- all muscle.

Title: The Bourne Ultimatum
Casts: Matt Damon,  Julia Stiles,  Joan Allen,  David Strathairn
Synopsis: Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) continues his international quest to uncover his true identity. From Russia to Europe to northern Africa...
Census: The Bourne Ultimatum is an intelligent, finely tuned non-stop thrill ride. Another strong performance from Matt Damon and sharp camerawork from Paul Greengrass make this the finest installment of the Bourne trilogy.

Title: Total Recall
Casts: Arnold Schwarzenegger,  Rachel Ticotin,  Sharon Stone,  Ronny Cox
Synopsis: Douglas Quaid (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is a bored construction worker in the year 2084 who dreams of visiting the colonized Mars....
Census: Under Paul Verhoeven's frenetic direction, Total Recall is a fast-paced rush of violence, gore, and humor that never slacks.

Title: Mad Max 2
Casts: Mel Gibson,  Bruce Spence,  Emil Minty,  Vernon Wells
Synopsis: After avenging the death of his wife and young son at the hands of a vicious gang leader, Max (Mel...
Census: The Road Warrior is everything a bigger-budgeted Mad Max sequel with should be: bigger, faster, louder, but definitely not dumber.

Title: Heat
Casts: Al Pacino,  Robert De Niro,  Val Kilmer,  Jon Voight
Synopsis: Master criminal Neil McCauley (Robert De Niro) is trying to control the rogue actions of one of his men, while...
Census: Though Al Pacino and Robert De Niro share but a handful of screen minutes together, Heat is an engrossing crime drama that draws compelling performances from its stars -- and confirms Michael Mann's mastery of the genre.

Title: The Raid: Redemption
Casts: Iko Uwais,  Joe Taslim,  Doni Alamsyah,  Yayan Ruhian
Synopsis: A rookie member of an elite team of commandos, Rama (Iko Uwais) is instructed to hang back while his comrades-in-arms...
Census: No frills and all thrills, The Raid: Redemption is an inventive action film expertly paced and edited for maximum entertainment.

Title: Mission: Impossible -- Fallout
Casts: Tom Cruise,  Henry Cavill,  Ving Rhames,  Simon Pegg
Synopsis: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team join forces with CIA assassin August Walker to prevent a disaster of epic proportions....
Census: Fast, sleek, and fun, Mission: Impossible - Fallout lives up to the "impossible" part of its name by setting yet another high mark for insane set pieces in a franchise full of them.

Title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
Casts: Harrison Ford,  Karen Allen,  Paul Freeman,  Wolf Kahler
Synopsis: Dr. Indiana Jones, a renowned archeologist and expert in the occult, is hired by the U.S. Government to find the...
Census: Featuring bravura set pieces, sly humor, and white-knuckle action, Raiders of the Lost Ark is one of the most consummately entertaining adventure pictures of all time.

Title: Aliens
Casts: Sigourney Weaver,  Carrie Henn,  Michael Biehn,  Paul Reiser
Synopsis: After floating in space for 57 years, Lt. Ripley's (Sigourney Weaver) shuttle is found by a deep space salvage team....
Census: While Alien was a marvel of slow-building, atmospheric tension, Aliens packs a much more visceral punch, and features a typically strong performance from Sigourney Weaver.

Title: Hard-Boiled
Casts: Chow Yun-Fat,  Bowie Lam,  Philip Chan,  Tony Leung Chiu Wai
Synopsis: A cop who loses his partner in a shoot-out with gun smugglers goes on a mission to catch them. In...
Census: Boasting impactful action as well as surprising emotional resonance, Hard Boiled is a powerful thriller that hits hard in more ways than one.

Title: The Matrix
Casts: Keanu Reeves,  Laurence Fishburne,  Carrie-Anne Moss,  Hugo Weaving
Synopsis: Neo (Keanu Reeves) believes that Morpheus (Laurence Fishburne), an elusive figure considered to be the most dangerous man alive, can...
Census: Thanks to the Wachowskis' imaginative vision, The Matrix is a smartly crafted combination of spectacular action and groundbreaking special effects.

Title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
Casts: Arnold Schwarzenegger,  Linda Hamilton,  Edward Furlong,  Robert Patrick
Synopsis: In this sequel set eleven years after "The Terminator," young John Connor (Edward Furlong), the key to civilization's victory over...
Census: T2 features thrilling action sequences and eye-popping visual effects, but what takes this sci-fi/ action landmark to the next level is the depth of the human (and cyborg) characters.

Title: Die Hard
Casts: Bruce Willis,  Alan Rickman,  Bonnie Bedelia,  Reginald VelJohnson
Synopsis: New York City policeman John McClane (Bruce Willis) is visiting his estranged wife (Bonnie Bedelia) and two daughters on Christmas...
Census: Its many imitators (and sequels) have never come close to matching the taut thrills of the definitive holiday action classic.

Title: Mad Max: Fury Road
Casts: Tom Hardy,  Charlize Theron,  Nicholas Hoult,  Hugh Keays-Byrne
Synopsis: Years after the collapse of civilization, the tyrannical Immortan Joe enslaves apocalypse survivors inside the desert fortress the Citadel. When...
Census: With exhilarating action and a surprising amount of narrative heft, Mad Max: Fury Road brings George Miller's post-apocalyptic franchise roaring vigorously back to life.
